message.content: We refer to ethical principles in medicine for help. The patient is of sound mind and has weighed the benefits and risks of stopping treatment. The mother’s wishes should be considered, but ultimately the patient has the right to make decisions about her own care. It would not be ethical to continue treatments against the patient’s wishes. It is important to provide support and counseling to both the patient and her mother. Continuing treatments until a psychiatric evaluation or seeking experimental treatments without the patient’s consent would also not be ethical.
